task.title: Microphone Placement Techniques
task.shortdesc: Learn how to position microphones effectively for optimal sound capture.

ul.li: Basic understanding of your sound source

context.p: Proper microphone placement is crucial for capturing the best possible sound. The position of the microphone relative to the sound source affects tone, presence, and balance.

info.p: Locate where the sound is originating and note any potential interference sources.
Ensure the stand is stable and can support the weight of your microphone.

substep.cmd: Start with the standard distance of 6-12 inches from the source
Adjust the angle based on the polar pattern of your microphone

info.p: Monitor the sound and make fine adjustments to achieve the desired tone.

result.p: When properly positioned, the microphone should capture a clear, balanced sound with minimal unwanted noise or coloration.
